We waste much time on trifles. (Active/Passive)
options: a) Much time was wasted on trifles
b) Much time will be wasted on trifles
c) Much time is wasted by us on trifles
d) Much time is wasted on trifles

questions.question: How was it managed by you? (Active/Passive)
options: a) How have you managed it?
c) How did you manage it ?
d) Was it managed by you ?

questions.question: I was obliged to go. (Active/Passive)
options: a) Circumstances obliges me to go
b) Circumstances oblige I should go
c) Circumstances oblige me to go
d) Circumstances obliged me to go

options: a) What I mean is understood by you?
b) Was what I mean understood by you?
c) Is what I mean understood by you?
d) What I mean is that understood by you?

b) The child's shrill wail was broken by the silence
c) The silence was broken by the child's shrill wail
d) The silence was being broken by the child's shrill wail

questions.question: He had hardly gone out then it began to rain (Sentence Improvement)
options: a) He had hardly gone out before it began to rain
b) He had hardly gone out when it began to rain
c) He had hardly gone out as it began to rain

options: a) He is the braver of the two soldiers
b) He is the bravest between the two soldiers
c) He is the bravest than the two soldiers

options: a) We have not less than a thousand students in our College
b) We have no fewer than a thousand students in our College
c) We have no little than a thousand students in our College

b) Hardly he had reached home when the telephone rang
c) Hardly did he reach home when the telephone rang

questions.question: He said to me. "What is it you have done?" (Direct/Indirect)
options: a) He asked me that what is it you have done
b) He asked me what it is I had done
c) He asked me what it was I had done
d) He asked me what it was I have done

questions.question: She said to him, "I have often told you this story." (Direct/Indirect)
options: a) She said to him that I have often told you this story
b) She told him that she has often told him that story
c) She told him that she have often told him the story
d) She told him that she had often told him that story

b) Kala asked Radha that who she has been speaking to over the phone
c) Kala asked Radha who she had been speaking to over the phone
d) Kala asked Radha that who she had been speaking to over the phone

questions.question: "Have you finished your work, Ahmad?". asked Vinod. (Direct/Indirect)
options: a) Vinod asked whether Ahmad had finished your work
b) Vinod asked whether Ahmad had finished work
c) Vinod asked whether Ahmad had finished their work
d) Vinod asked Ahmad whether he had finished his work

questions.question: He exclaimed with joy that their team had won the tournament. (Direct/Indirect)
options: a) He exclaimed. "Hurrah! Our team has won the tournament."
b) He said, "Our team won the tournament."
c) He said, "Wow! Our team won the tournament."
d) He said, "Alas! Our team won the tournament."

questions.question: The young man promised her that he would be there the next day. (Direct/Indirect)
options: a) The young man said, "I will be there the next day."
b) The young man said. "I promise to be here tomorrow."
c) The young man said, "I will promise to be there the next day."
d) The young man said. "Promise. I will be here today."
